clues.text: John Kenneth Galbraith said these "are indispensable when you don't want to do anything"--there's one in the boardroom at 2:30

In a saying attributed to the Duke of Wellington, this battle "was won on the playing fields of Eton"
Jean-Luc Godard said, "Photography is truth, and" this "is truth 24 times a second"
"Dulce et decorum est pro patria mori", wrote Horace, "It is a sweet and seemly thing to die for" this

rounds.comments: (Alex: And finally, in honor of Martin Luther King Day...)

In the English bond style, these are laid in alternate courses of headers & stretchers

rounds.category: I JUST LIKE SAYING THESE WORDS

clues.text: As I reflect on the word "genuflect", I remember it means to bend this

Used to mean a vulnerable weak point in an enemy's defenses, it means the lower abdomen
Enjoy this $2000 quanswer--see, I'm one of these, a creator of new words

rounds.category: THERE IS NO PLACE LIKE NEBRASKA

clues.text: The USA's emergency 911 system was developed & first used in this "presidential" city
This man organized his famous "Wild West Show" in 1883 at his ranch near North Platte
In 1948 Nebraska's Offutt Air Force Base became home to SAC, which stood for this
The U. of N. College of Agriculture helped develop the technology for this McDonald's McPork sandwich
The childhood home of Willa Cather, this colorfully named town inspired the setting for her 6 Nebraska novels
This large bird was once found as far as the deserts of Arabia & Syria but is now confined to parts of Africa
About the size of a chicken, it's strictly protected by New Zealand law
The Adelie species of this bird is distinguished by the white spectacle-like ring around each eye
Native to Mauritius & now extinct, it's known mainly by early drawings & body fragments in museums
It's Australia's national bird
Depictions of Pilgrim hats are featured on the signs for this Bay State's turnpike

This Midwestern city's Madison & State Streets form the basis for its address system
This street in New Orleans' French Quarter was named for an 18th century French royal family, not the whiskey

rounds.text: This man is the only U.S. president since Hoover not named Time magazine's Man or Person of the Year
